Entities.Name: Infection or IFI
Entities.Definition: A clinical query indicating a suspected invasive fungal infection or general infection, often found in the 'clinical notes' section.

Entities.Name: Risk factor
Entities.Definition: Mentions of host-related conditions or treatments indicating elevated risk of developing an IFI.

Entities.Name: Abnormality
Entities.Definition: Text spans indicating mixed radiologic findings (from PET and/or CT) suggestive of IFI.
Entities.SampleData: FDG-avid lesion in left upper lobe with cavitation

Entities.Name: Abnormality PET
Entities.Definition: Metabolic abnormality identified via PET scan, suggestive of IFI.

Entities.Name: Abnormality CT
Entities.Definition: Structural abnormality identified via CT scan, suggestive of IFI.

Entities.Name: Sinus
Entities.Definition: Sinus region referenced in relation to IFI-related abnormality.

Entities.Name: Other
Entities.Definition: Other anatomical locations associated with IFI-related abnormalities, excluding lung and sinus.

Entities.Name: Infection/inflammation
Entities.Definition: Mentions of infection or inflammation, particularly in findings or conclusions. Includes ‘IFI indication’ subtype.

Entities.Name: Positive
Entities.Definition: Affirmative expressions confirming the presence of an IFI-related abnormality or condition.

Entities.Name: Equivocal
Entities.Definition: Uncertain or ambiguous expressions about IFI presence.

Entities.Name: Negative
Entities.Definition: Expressions negating the presence of IFI.

Entities.Name: Improvement
Entities.Definition: Language indicating that a previously described abnormality or infection has improved.

Entities.Name: Stable
Entities.Definition: Language indicating no change in abnormality status.

Entities.Name: Worsening
Entities.Definition: Language indicating progression or deterioration of an abnormality or infection.

Dataset.Name: PIFIR (PET-CT Invasive Fungal Infection Reports)
Dataset.Description: A dataset of 201 de-identified PET-CT radiology reports annotated for IFI-related concepts and relations. Created for developing NLP tools for IFI surveillance.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Annotations capture 15 entity types including IFI indicators, anatomical locations, and modifiers of certainty or progression. Relations describe location, certainty, and progression associations. The schema was developed iteratively with adjudication by two radiologists. Final annotations are provided in BRAT standoff format.
